channel.title: Source Shaders flowgraph-based Editor
channel.description:
This looks extremely interesting. [quote] This WYSIWYG editor allows the user to create, compile and implement new shaders easily into a source mod without any preliminary knowledge of HLSL.
The shaders are based on nodes which are connected over bridges to finally compose a flowgraph for each, the vertex and pixel shader (similar to shader/material editors that you may know from other engines). Any shaders created this way can be referenced by a vmt file in a similar manner to shaders that have been created through code.
Note: Shaders created through the editor will not work properly in Hammer or HLMV due to their non-hardcoded nature. [/quote] [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=82AMwQGjc8Y[/url]
More info and usage instructions. [url]https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Category:SourceShaderEditor[/url]

item.title: Source Shaders flowgraph-based Editor
item.dc:creator: ShadowNate
item.description:
This looks extremely interesting.

This WYSIWYG editor allows the user to create, compile and implement new shaders easily into a source mod without any preliminary knowledge of HLSL.

The shaders are based on nodes which are connected over bridges to finally compose a flowgraph for each, the vertex and pixel shader (similar to shader/material editors that you may know from other engines). Any shaders created this way can be referenced by a vmt file in a similar manner to shaders that have been created through code.

Note: Shaders created through the editor will not work properly in Hammer or HLMV due to their non-hardcoded nature.
